args:
--metadata-from-file=user-data=<#cloud-config
bootcmd:
- echo in-bootcmd
- echo "Starting cloudinit bootcmd..." >> /var/log/hermit.log
- mount
- umount /tmp
- mount --bind /var/tmp /tmp
- echo in-bootcmd-after-tmp-remount
- mount
- echo "Starting check filesystem /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd" >> /var/log/hermit.log
- fsck -C 1 -a /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd >> /var/log/hermit.log
- echo "Finished checking filesystem /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd" >> /var/log/hermit.log
- mkdir -p /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd
- echo "Mounting /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd" as /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd
  >> /var/log/hermit.log
- mount -t ext4 /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd
- mkdir -p /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh
- echo "Finished hermit VM setup" >> /var/log/hermit.log
runcmd:
- echo in-runcmd
- bash /home/cloudservice/hermit-setup.sh >> /var/log/hermit.log 2>&1
users:
- name: ubuntu
write_files:
- content: 'ssh-rsa X'
  path: /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh/authorized_keys
  permissions: '0700'
- content: "import subprocess\nimport re\nimport time\nimport argparse\nimport os\n\
    \n# cmd to suspend: docker run google/cloud-sdk gcloud compute instances suspend\
    \ {name} --zone {zone}\n# but needs additional scopes/permissions. Create a service\
    \ account for this? Actually just a broadening the scope looks sufficient\nimport\
    \ logging\n\nlog = logging.getLogger(__name__)\n\n\ndef main():\n    parser =\
    \ argparse.ArgumentParser()\n    parser.add_argument(\"poll_frequency\", type=float)\n\
    \    parser.add_argument(\"activity_timeout\", type=float)\n    parser.add_argument(\"\
    name\")\n    parser.add_argument(\"zone\")\n    parser.add_argument(\"project\"\
    )\n    parser.add_argument(\"port\")\n    args = parser.parse_args()\n\n    logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)\n\
    \n    # fetch docker image at the beginning just to make sure it's successful\
    \ and we don't wait until\n    # we actually need it.\n    subprocess.check_call([\"\
    docker\", \"pull\", \"google/cloud-sdk\"])\n\n    poll(\n        args.poll_frequency\
    \ * 60,\n        args.activity_timeout * 60,\n        args.name,\n        args.zone,\n\
    \        args.project,\n        args.port,\n    )\n\n\ndef poll(poll_frequency,\
    \ activity_timeout, name, zone, project, port):\n    suspend_fail_count = 0\n\
    \    last_bytes_transmitted = None\n    last_activity = time.time()\n    while\
    \ True:\n        bytes_transmitted = get_bytes_transmitted(port)\n        if last_bytes_transmitted\
    \ != bytes_transmitted:\n            last_bytes_transmitted = bytes_transmitted\n\
    \            last_activity = time.time()\n            log.info(\"%s\", f\"active\
    \ (last_bytes_transmitted={last_bytes_transmitted})\")\n\n            # reset\
    \ if there's some activity. Only want to count the number of failed suspends since\
    \ we've decided that we're idle\n            suspend_fail_count = 0\n        elapsed_since_activity\
    \ = time.time() - last_activity\n        if elapsed_since_activity > activity_timeout:\n\
    \            log.info(\n                \"%s\",\n                f\"{elapsed_since_activity}\
    \ seconds elapsed since last sign of activity. Suspending...\",\n            )\n\
    \            successful_suspend = suspend_instance(name, zone, project)\n    \
    \        log.info(\n                f\"Suspend is over. Waiting for {activity_timeout/60}\
    \ minutes before polling again\"\n            )\n            time.sleep(activity_timeout)\n\
    \            # this is likely after the VM has been resumed but ...\n        \
    \    # it's been observed that the suspend command often reports failure even\
    \ though the vm successfully suspended.\n            # I don't have a reliable\
    \ way of telling whether it worked or not. (Specificly, it gets a timeout trying\
    \ to read the response\n            # to the suspend request, because while it\
    \ was\n            # reading, the VM got suspended. ) In the event that suspend\
    \ _really_ is broken, we want to shutdown as that's\n            # safer then\
    \ leaving the machine run forever. So, let's go with a heuristic of, if it fails\
    \ repeatedly then shutdown.\n\n            if not successful_suspend:\n      \
    \          log.info(\n                    \"Suspend command reportedly failed\
    \ -- but not sure if that's true. Incrementing fail count\"\n                )\n\
    \                suspend_fail_count += 1\n\n                if suspend_fail_count\
    \ > 10:\n                    log.info(\n                        f\"suspending\
    \ failed {suspend_fail_count} times. Shutting down as a last resort\"\n      \
    \              )\n                    _shutdown()\n\n            log.info(\"Resuming\
    \ polling...\")\n        time.sleep(poll_frequency)\n\n\ndef _shutdown():\n  \
    \  return_code = subprocess.run([\"shutdown\", \"--poweroff\"]).returncode\n \
    \   log.info(f\"return code = {return_code}\")\n\n\ndef suspend_instance(name,\
    \ zone, project):\n    has_ssd = os.path.exists(\"/mnt/disks/local-ssd-0\")\n\
    \    cmd = [\n        \"docker\",\n        \"run\",\n        \"google/cloud-sdk\"\
    ,\n        \"gcloud\",\n        \"compute\",\n        \"instances\",\n       \
    \ \"suspend\",\n        name,\n        \"--zone\",\n        zone,\n        \"\
    --project\",\n        project,\n    ]\n\n    if has_ssd:\n        cmd.append(\"\
    --discard-local-ssd=false\")\n\n    return_code = subprocess.run(cmd).returncode\n\
    \n    return return_code == 0\n\n\ndef get_bytes_transmitted(port):\n    output\
    \ = subprocess.check_output([\"iptables\", \"-nvxL\", \"CONTAINER_SSH\"])\n  \
    \  lines = output.decode(\"utf8\").split(\"\\n\")\n\n    def parse():\n      \
    \  for line in lines:\n            if (\n                f\"tcp dpt:{port}\" in\
    \ line\n            ):  # find the line for the rule for traffic on the port\n\
    \                m = re.match(\"\\\\s*(\\\\d+)\\\\s+(\\\\d+)\\\\s+.\", line)\n\
    \                if m is not None:\n                    return int(m.group(2))\n\
    \        return None  # could not find the rule\n\n    result = parse()\n    if\
    \ result is None:\n        print(f\"Could not parse: {output}\")\n    return result\n\
    \n\nif __name__ == \"__main__\":\n    main()\n"
  path: /home/cloudservice/suspend_on_idle.py
- content: '

    set -ex

    echo "initial mount state"

    mount

    echo "Setting up ubuntu home directory permissions..."

    usermod -u 2000 ubuntu

    groupmod -g 2000 ubuntu

    chown 2000:2000 /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu

    chmod -R 700 /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh

    chown -R 2000:2000 /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh

    echo "Mounting home directory into place..."

    mount --bind /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/ /home/ubuntu

    chown ubuntu:ubuntu /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh/authorized_keys

    chmod 0666 /var/run/docker.sock

    echo "Starting up services..."

    systemctl daemon-reload

    systemctl restart docker

    systemctl start container-sshd.service

    systemctl start suspend-on-idle.service

    echo "final mount state"

    mount

    echo "hermit-setup.sh complete"

    '
  path: /home/cloudservice/hermit-setup.sh
- content: '

    # Create a chain for tracking traffic to ssh in container

    iptables -N CONTAINER_SSH

    iptables -I INPUT -j CONTAINER_SSH

    iptables -A CONTAINER_SSH -p tcp --dport 3022

    iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --dport 3022 -j ACCEPT

    '
  path: /home/cloudservice/setup_firewall
- content: '

    [Unit]

    Description=Configures the host firewall


    [Service]

    Type=oneshot

    RemainAfterExit=true

    ExecStart=/bin/sh /home/cloudservice/setup_firewall

    '
  owner: root
  path: /etc/systemd/system/config-firewall.service
  permissions: '0644'
- content: '

    [Unit]

    Description=Container which we can connect via ssh

    Wants=gcr-online.target config-firewall.service

    After=gcr-online.target config-firewall.service


    [Service]

    Environment="HOME=/home/cloudservice"

    StandardOutput=append:/var/log/hermit.log

    ExecStartPre=/usr/bin/docker-credential-gcr configure-docker --registries us-central1-docker.pkg.dev

    ExecStart=/usr/bin/docker run --rm --name=container-sshd --network=host -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    -v /tmp:/tmp -v /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu:/home/ubuntu us-central1-docker.pkg.dev/depmap-omics/docker/hermit-dev-env:v1
    /usr/sbin/sshd -D -e -p 3022

    ExecStop=/usr/bin/docker stop container-sshd

    ExecStopPost=/usr/bin/docker rm container-sshd

    Restart=always

    '
  owner: root
  path: /etc/systemd/system/container-sshd.service
  permissions: '0644'
- content: '

    [Unit]

    Description=Suspend when container is detected to be idle

    Wants=gcr-online.target

    After=gcr-online.target


    [Service]

    ExecStart=/usr/bin/python /home/cloudservice/suspend_on_idle.py 1 30 hermit-demo
    us-central1-a broad-achilles 3022

    Restart=always'
  owner: root
  path: /etc/systemd/system/suspend-on-idle.service
  permissions: '0644'
- content: "\n{\n\t\"live-restore\": false,\n\t\"log-opts\": {\n                \"\
    tag\": \"{{.Name}}\"\n        },\n\t\"storage-driver\": \"overlay2\",\n\t\"mtu\"\
    : 1460\n}\n"
  owner: root
  path: /etc/docker/daemon.json
  permissions: '0644'
>

returned.description: hermit v2.1.0 VM started user hermit-test

items.value:
#cloud-config
bootcmd:
- echo in-bootcmd
- echo "Starting cloudinit bootcmd..." >> /var/log/hermit.log
- mount
- umount /tmp
- mount --bind /var/tmp /tmp
- echo in-bootcmd-after-tmp-remount
- mount
- echo "Starting check filesystem /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd" >> /var/log/hermit.log
- fsck -C 1 -a /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd >> /var/log/hermit.log
- echo "Finished checking filesystem /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd" >> /var/log/hermit.log
- mkdir -p /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd
- echo "Mounting /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd" as /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd
  >> /var/log/hermit.log
- mount -t ext4 /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd
- mkdir -p /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh
- echo "Finished hermit VM setup" >> /var/log/hermit.log
runcmd:
- echo in-runcmd
- bash /home/cloudservice/hermit-setup.sh >> /var/log/hermit.log 2>&1
users:
- name: ubuntu
write_files:
- content: 'ssh-rsa 
    pmontgom@MBRCF0-08B

    '
  path: /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh/authorized_keys
  permissions: '0700'
- content: "import subprocess\nimport re\nimport time\nimport argparse\nimport os\n\
    \n# cmd to suspend: docker run google/cloud-sdk gcloud compute instances suspend\
    \ {name} --zone {zone}\n# but needs additional scopes/permissions. Create a service\
    \ account for this? Actually just a broadening the scope looks sufficient\nimport\
    \ logging\n\nlog = logging.getLogger(__name__)\n\n\ndef main():\n    parser =\
    \ argparse.ArgumentParser()\n    parser.add_argument(\"poll_frequency\", type=float)\n\
    \    parser.add_argument(\"activity_timeout\", type=float)\n    parser.add_argument(\"\
    name\")\n    parser.add_argument(\"zone\")\n    parser.add_argument(\"project\"\
    )\n    parser.add_argument(\"port\")\n    args = parser.parse_args()\n\n    logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)\n\
    \n    # fetch docker image at the beginning just to make sure it's successful\
    \ and we don't wait until\n    # we actually need it.\n    subprocess.check_call([\"\
    docker\", \"pull\", \"google/cloud-sdk\"])\n\n    poll(\n        args.poll_frequency\
    \ * 60,\n        args.activity_timeout * 60,\n        args.name,\n        args.zone,\n\
    \        args.project,\n        args.port,\n    )\n\n\ndef poll(poll_frequency,\
    \ activity_timeout, name, zone, project, port):\n    suspend_fail_count = 0\n\
    \    last_bytes_transmitted = None\n    last_activity = time.time()\n    while\
    \ True:\n        bytes_transmitted = get_bytes_transmitted(port)\n        if last_bytes_transmitted\
    \ != bytes_transmitted:\n            last_bytes_transmitted = bytes_transmitted\n\
    \            last_activity = time.time()\n            log.info(\"%s\", f\"active\
    \ (last_bytes_transmitted={last_bytes_transmitted})\")\n\n            # reset\
    \ if there's some activity. Only want to count the number of failed suspends since\
    \ we've decided that we're idle\n            suspend_fail_count = 0\n        elapsed_since_activity\
    \ = time.time() - last_activity\n        if elapsed_since_activity > activity_timeout:\n\
    \            log.info(\n                \"%s\",\n                f\"{elapsed_since_activity}\
    \ seconds elapsed since last sign of activity. Suspending...\",\n            )\n\
    \            successful_suspend = suspend_instance(name, zone, project)\n    \
    \        log.info(\n                f\"Suspend is over. Waiting for {activity_timeout/60}\
    \ minutes before polling again\"\n            )\n            time.sleep(activity_timeout)\n\
    \            # this is likely after the VM has been resumed but ...\n        \
    \    # it's been observed that the suspend command often reports failure even\
    \ though the vm successfully suspended.\n            # I don't have a reliable\
    \ way of telling whether it worked or not. (Specificly, it gets a timeout trying\
    \ to read the response\n            # to the suspend request, because while it\
    \ was\n            # reading, the VM got suspended. ) In the event that suspend\
    \ _really_ is broken, we want to shutdown as that's\n            # safer then\
    \ leaving the machine run forever. So, let's go with a heuristic of, if it fails\
    \ repeatedly then shutdown.\n\n            if not successful_suspend:\n      \

    \                suspend_fail_count += 1\n\n                if suspend_fail_count\
    \ > 10:\n                    log.info(\n                        f\"suspending\
    \ failed {suspend_fail_count} times. Shutting down as a last resort\"\n      \
    \              )\n                    _shutdown()\n\n            log.info(\"Resuming\
    \ polling...\")\n        time.sleep(poll_frequency)\n\n\ndef _shutdown():\n  \
    \  return_code = subprocess.run([\"shutdown\", \"--poweroff\"]).returncode\n \
    \   log.info(f\"return code = {return_code}\")\n\n\ndef suspend_instance(name,\
    \ zone, project):\n    has_ssd = os.path.exists(\"/mnt/disks/local-ssd-0\")\n\
    \    cmd = [\n        \"docker\",\n        \"run\",\n        \"google/cloud-sdk\"\
    ,\n        \"gcloud\",\n        \"compute\",\n        \"instances\",\n       \
    \ \"suspend\",\n        name,\n        \"--zone\",\n        zone,\n        \"\
    --project\",\n        project,\n    ]\n\n    if has_ssd:\n        cmd.append(\"\
    --discard-local-ssd=false\")\n\n    return_code = subprocess.run(cmd).returncode\n\
    \n    return return_code == 0\n\n\ndef get_bytes_transmitted(port):\n    output\
    \ = subprocess.check_output([\"iptables\", \"-nvxL\", \"CONTAINER_SSH\"])\n  \
    \  lines = output.decode(\"utf8\").split(\"\\n\")\n\n    def parse():\n      \
    \  for line in lines:\n            if (\n                f\"tcp dpt:{port}\" in\
    \ line\n            ):  # find the line for the rule for traffic on the port\n\
    \                m = re.match(\"\\\\s*(\\\\d+)\\\\s+(\\\\d+)\\\\s+.\", line)\n\
    \                if m is not None:\n                    return int(m.group(2))\n\

    \ result is None:\n        print(f\"Could not parse: {output}\")\n    return result\n\

  path: /home/cloudservice/suspend_on_idle.py
- content: '

    set -ex

    echo "initial mount state"

    mount

    echo "Setting up ubuntu home directory permissions..."

    usermod -u 2000 ubuntu

    groupmod -g 2000 ubuntu

    chown 2000:2000 /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu

    chmod -R 700 /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh

    chown -R 2000:2000 /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh

    echo "Mounting home directory into place..."

    mount --bind /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/ /home/ubuntu

    chown ubuntu:ubuntu /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh/authorized_keys

    chmod 0666 /var/run/docker.sock

    echo "Starting up services..."

    systemctl daemon-reload

    systemctl restart docker

    systemctl start container-sshd.service

    systemctl start suspend-on-idle.service

    echo "final mount state"

    mount

    echo "hermit-setup.sh complete"

    '
  path: /home/cloudservice/hermit-setup.sh
- content: '

    # Create a chain for tracking traffic to ssh in container

    iptables -N CONTAINER_SSH

    iptables -I INPUT -j CONTAINER_SSH

    iptables -A CONTAINER_SSH -p tcp --dport 3022

    iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --dport 3022 -j ACCEPT

    '
  path: /home/cloudservice/setup_firewall
- content: '

    [Unit]

    Description=Configures the host firewall


    [Service]

    Type=oneshot

    RemainAfterExit=true

    ExecStart=/bin/sh /home/cloudservice/setup_firewall

    '
  owner: root
  path: /etc/systemd/system/config-firewall.service
  permissions: '0644'
- content: '

    [Unit]

    Description=Container which we can connect via ssh

    Wants=gcr-online.target config-firewall.service

    After=gcr-online.target config-firewall.service


    [Service]

    Environment="HOME=/home/cloudservice"

    StandardOutput=append:/var/log/hermit.log

    ExecStartPre=/usr/bin/docker-credential-gcr configure-docker --registries us-central1-docker.pkg.dev

    ExecStart=/usr/bin/docker run --rm --name=container-sshd --network=host -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    -v /tmp:/tmp -v /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu:/home/ubuntu us-central1-docker.pkg.dev/depmap-omics/docker/hermit-dev-env:v1
    /usr/sbin/sshd -D -e -p 3022

    ExecStop=/usr/bin/docker stop container-sshd

    ExecStopPost=/usr/bin/docker rm container-sshd

    Restart=always

    '
  owner: root
  path: /etc/systemd/system/container-sshd.service
  permissions: '0644'
- content: '

    [Unit]

    Description=Suspend when container is detected to be idle

    Wants=gcr-online.target

    After=gcr-online.target


    [Service]

    ExecStart=/usr/bin/python /home/cloudservice/suspend_on_idle.py 1 30 hermit-demo
    us-central1-a broad-achilles 3022

    Restart=always'
  owner: root
  path: /etc/systemd/system/suspend-on-idle.service
  permissions: '0644'
- content: "\n{\n\t\"live-restore\": false,\n\t\"log-opts\": {\n                \"\
    tag\": \"{{.Name}}\"\n        },\n\t\"storage-driver\": \"overlay2\",\n\t\"mtu\"\
    : 1460\n}\n"
  owner: root
  path: /etc/docker/daemon.json
  permissions: '0644'

- content: "import subprocess\nimport re\nimport time\nimport argparse\nimport os\n\
    \n# cmd to suspend: docker run google/cloud-sdk gcloud compute instances suspend\
    \ {name} --zone {zone}\n# but needs additional scopes/permissions. Create a service\

    \ logging\n\nlog = logging.getLogger(__name__)\n\n\ndef main():\n    parser =\
    \ argparse.ArgumentParser()\n    parser.add_argument(\"poll_frequency\", type=float)\n\
    \    parser.add_argument(\"activity_timeout\", type=float)\n    parser.add_argument(\"\
    name\")\n    parser.add_argument(\"zone\")\n    parser.add_argument(\"project\"\
    )\n    parser.add_argument(\"port\")\n    args = parser.parse_args()\n\n    logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)\n\
    \n    # fetch docker image at the beginning just to make sure it's successful\
    \ and we don't wait until\n    # we actually need it.\n    subprocess.check_call([\"\
    docker\", \"pull\", \"google/cloud-sdk\"])\n\n    poll(\n        args.poll_frequency\
    \ * 60,\n        args.activity_timeout * 60,\n        args.name,\n        args.zone,\n\
    \        args.project,\n        args.port,\n    )\n\n\ndef poll(poll_frequency,\
    \ activity_timeout, name, zone, project, port):\n    suspend_fail_count = 0\n\
    \    last_bytes_transmitted = None\n    last_activity = time.time()\n    while\
    \ True:\n        bytes_transmitted = get_bytes_transmitted(port)\n        if last_bytes_transmitted\
    \ != bytes_transmitted:\n            last_bytes_transmitted = bytes_transmitted\n\
    \            last_activity = time.time()\n            log.info(\"%s\", f\"active\
    \ (last_bytes_transmitted={last_bytes_transmitted})\")\n\n            # reset\
    \ if there's some activity. Only want to count the number of failed suspends since\
    \ we've decided that we're idle\n            suspend_fail_count = 0\n        elapsed_since_activity\
    \ = time.time() - last_activity\n        if elapsed_since_activity > activity_timeout:\n\
    \            log.info(\n                \"%s\",\n                f\"{elapsed_since_activity}\
    \ seconds elapsed since last sign of activity. Suspending...\",\n            )\n\
    \            successful_suspend = suspend_instance(name, zone, project)\n    \
    \        log.info(\n                f\"Suspend is over. Waiting for {activity_timeout/60}\
    \ minutes before polling again\"\n            )\n            time.sleep(activity_timeout)\n\
    \            # this is likely after the VM has been resumed but ...\n        \
    \    # it's been observed that the suspend command often reports failure even\
    \ though the vm successfully suspended.\n            # I don't have a reliable\
    \ way of telling whether it worked or not. (Specificly, it gets a timeout trying\
    \ to read the response\n            # to the suspend request, because while it\
    \ was\n            # reading, the VM got suspended. ) In the event that suspend\
    \ _really_ is broken, we want to shutdown as that's\n            # safer then\
    \ leaving the machine run forever. So, let's go with a heuristic of, if it fails\
    \ repeatedly then shutdown.\n\n            if not successful_suspend:\n      \
    \          log.info(\n                    \"Suspend command reportedly failed\
    \ -- but not sure if that's true. Incrementing fail count\"\n                )\n\
    \                suspend_fail_count += 1\n\n                if suspend_fail_count\
    \ > 10:\n                    log.info(\n                        f\"suspending\
    \ failed {suspend_fail_count} times. Shutting down as a last resort\"\n      \
    \              )\n                    _shutdown()\n\n            log.info(\"Resuming\
    \ polling...\")\n        time.sleep(poll_frequency)\n\n\ndef _shutdown():\n  \
    \  return_code = subprocess.run([\"shutdown\", \"--poweroff\"]).returncode\n \
    \   log.info(f\"return code = {return_code}\")\n\n\ndef suspend_instance(name,\
    \ zone, project):\n    has_ssd = os.path.exists(\"/mnt/disks/local-ssd-0\")\n\
    \    cmd = [\n        \"docker\",\n        \"run\",\n        \"google/cloud-sdk\"\
    ,\n        \"gcloud\",\n        \"compute\",\n        \"instances\",\n       \
    \ \"suspend\",\n        name,\n        \"--zone\",\n        zone,\n        \"\
    --project\",\n        project,\n    ]\n\n    if has_ssd:\n        cmd.append(\"\
    --discard-local-ssd=false\")\n\n    return_code = subprocess.run(cmd).returncode\n\
    \n    return return_code == 0\n\n\ndef get_bytes_transmitted(port):\n    output\
    \ = subprocess.check_output([\"iptables\", \"-nvxL\", \"CONTAINER_SSH\"])\n  \
    \  lines = output.decode(\"utf8\").split(\"\\n\")\n\n    def parse():\n      \
    \  for line in lines:\n            if (\n                f\"tcp dpt:{port}\" in\
    \ line\n            ):  # find the line for the rule for traffic on the port\n\
    \                m = re.match(\"\\\\s*(\\\\d+)\\\\s+(\\\\d+)\\\\s+.\", line)\n\
    \                if m is not None:\n                    return int(m.group(2))\n\
    \        return None  # could not find the rule\n\n    result = parse()\n    if\
    \ result is None:\n        print(f\"Could not parse: {output}\")\n    return result\n\
    \n\nif __name__ == \"__main__\":\n    main()\n"

items.value:
#cloud-config
bootcmd:
- echo in-bootcmd
- echo "Starting cloudinit bootcmd..." >> /var/log/hermit.log
- mount
- umount /tmp
- mount --bind /var/tmp /tmp
- echo in-bootcmd-after-tmp-remount
- mount
- echo "Starting check filesystem /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd" >> /var/log/hermit.log
- fsck -C 1 -a /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd >> /var/log/hermit.log
- echo "Finished checking filesystem /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd" >> /var/log/hermit.log
- mkdir -p /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd
- echo "Mounting /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd" as /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd
  >> /var/log/hermit.log
- mount -t ext4 /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd
- mkdir -p /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh
- echo "Finished hermit VM setup" >> /var/log/hermit.log
runcmd:
- echo in-runcmd
- bash /home/cloudservice/hermit-setup.sh >> /var/log/hermit.log 2>&1
users:
- name: ubuntu
write_files:
- content: 'ssh-rsa 
    pmontgom@MBRCF0-08B

    '
  path: /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh/authorized_keys
  permissions: '0700'
- content: "import subprocess\nimport re\nimport time\nimport argparse\nimport os\n\
    \n# cmd to suspend: docker run google/cloud-sdk gcloud compute instances suspend\
    \ {name} --zone {zone}\n# but needs additional scopes/permissions. Create a service\
    \ account for this? Actually just a broadening the scope looks sufficient\nimport\
    \ logging\n\nlog = logging.getLogger(__name__)\n\n\ndef main():\n    parser =\
    \ argparse.ArgumentParser()\n    parser.add_argument(\"poll_frequency\", type=float)\n\
    \    parser.add_argument(\"activity_timeout\", type=float)\n    parser.add_argument(\"\
    name\")\n    parser.add_argument(\"zone\")\n    parser.add_argument(\"project\"\
    )\n    parser.add_argument(\"port\")\n    args = parser.parse_args()\n\n    logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)\n\
    \n    # fetch docker image at the beginning just to make sure it's successful\
    \ and we don't wait until\n    # we actually need it.\n    subprocess.check_call([\"\
    docker\", \"pull\", \"google/cloud-sdk\"])\n\n    poll(\n        args.poll_frequency\
    \ * 60,\n        args.activity_timeout * 60,\n        args.name,\n        args.zone,\n\
    \        args.project,\n        args.port,\n    )\n\n\ndef poll(poll_frequency,\
    \ activity_timeout, name, zone, project, port):\n    suspend_fail_count = 0\n\
    \    last_bytes_transmitted = None\n    last_activity = time.time()\n    while\
    \ True:\n        bytes_transmitted = get_bytes_transmitted(port)\n        if last_bytes_transmitted\
    \ != bytes_transmitted:\n            last_bytes_transmitted = bytes_transmitted\n\
    \            last_activity = time.time()\n            log.info(\"%s\", f\"active\
    \ (last_bytes_transmitted={last_bytes_transmitted})\")\n\n            # reset\
    \ if there's some activity. Only want to count the number of failed suspends since\
    \ we've decided that we're idle\n            suspend_fail_count = 0\n        elapsed_since_activity\
    \ = time.time() - last_activity\n        if elapsed_since_activity > activity_timeout:\n\
    \            log.info(\n                \"%s\",\n                f\"{elapsed_since_activity}\
    \ seconds elapsed since last sign of activity. Suspending...\",\n            )\n\
    \            successful_suspend = suspend_instance(name, zone, project)\n    \
    \        log.info(\n                f\"Suspend is over. Waiting for {activity_timeout/60}\
    \ minutes before polling again\"\n            )\n            time.sleep(activity_timeout)\n\
    \            # this is likely after the VM has been resumed but ...\n        \
    \    # it's been observed that the suspend command often reports failure even\
    \ though the vm successfully suspended.\n            # I don't have a reliable\
    \ way of telling whether it worked or not. (Specificly, it gets a timeout trying\
    \ to read the response\n            # to the suspend request, because while it\
    \ was\n            # reading, the VM got suspended. ) In the event that suspend\
    \ _really_ is broken, we want to shutdown as that's\n            # safer then\
    \ leaving the machine run forever. So, let's go with a heuristic of, if it fails\
    \ repeatedly then shutdown.\n\n            if not successful_suspend:\n      \
    \          log.info(\n                    \"Suspend command reportedly failed\
    \ -- but not sure if that's true. Incrementing fail count\"\n                )\n\
    \                suspend_fail_count += 1\n\n                if suspend_fail_count\
    \ > 10:\n                    log.info(\n                        f\"suspending\
    \ failed {suspend_fail_count} times. Shutting down as a last resort\"\n      \
    \              )\n                    _shutdown()\n\n            log.info(\"Resuming\
    \ polling...\")\n        time.sleep(poll_frequency)\n\n\ndef _shutdown():\n  \
    \  return_code = subprocess.run([\"shutdown\", \"--poweroff\"]).returncode\n \
    \   log.info(f\"return code = {return_code}\")\n\n\ndef suspend_instance(name,\
    \ zone, project):\n    has_ssd = os.path.exists(\"/mnt/disks/local-ssd-0\")\n\
    \    cmd = [\n        \"docker\",\n        \"run\",\n        \"google/cloud-sdk\"\
    ,\n        \"gcloud\",\n        \"compute\",\n        \"instances\",\n       \
    \ \"suspend\",\n        name,\n        \"--zone\",\n        zone,\n        \"\
    --project\",\n        project,\n    ]\n\n    if has_ssd:\n        cmd.append(\"\
    --discard-local-ssd=false\")\n\n    return_code = subprocess.run(cmd).returncode\n\
    \n    return return_code == 0\n\n\ndef get_bytes_transmitted(port):\n    output\
    \ = subprocess.check_output([\"iptables\", \"-nvxL\", \"CONTAINER_SSH\"])\n  \
    \  lines = output.decode(\"utf8\").split(\"\\n\")\n\n    def parse():\n      \
    \  for line in lines:\n            if (\n                f\"tcp dpt:{port}\" in\
    \ line\n            ):  # find the line for the rule for traffic on the port\n\
    \                m = re.match(\"\\\\s*(\\\\d+)\\\\s+(\\\\d+)\\\\s+.\", line)\n\
    \                if m is not None:\n                    return int(m.group(2))\n\
    \        return None  # could not find the rule\n\n    result = parse()\n    if\
    \ result is None:\n        print(f\"Could not parse: {output}\")\n    return result\n\
    \n\nif __name__ == \"__main__\":\n    main()\n"
  path: /home/cloudservice/suspend_on_idle.py
- content: '

    set -ex

    echo "initial mount state"

    mount

    echo "Setting up ubuntu home directory permissions..."

    usermod -u 2000 ubuntu

    groupmod -g 2000 ubuntu

    chown 2000:2000 /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu

    chmod -R 700 /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh

    chown -R 2000:2000 /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh

    echo "Mounting home directory into place..."

    mount --bind /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/ /home/ubuntu

    chown ubuntu:ubuntu /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh/authorized_keys

    chmod 0666 /var/run/docker.sock

    echo "Starting up services..."

    systemctl daemon-reload

    systemctl restart docker

    systemctl start container-sshd.service

    systemctl start suspend-on-idle.service

    echo "final mount state"

    mount

    echo "hermit-setup.sh complete"

    '
  path: /home/cloudservice/hermit-setup.sh
- content: '

    # Create a chain for tracking traffic to ssh in container

    iptables -N CONTAINER_SSH

    iptables -I INPUT -j CONTAINER_SSH

    iptables -A CONTAINER_SSH -p tcp --dport 3022

    iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --dport 3022 -j ACCEPT

    '
  path: /home/cloudservice/setup_firewall
- content: '

    [Unit]

    Description=Configures the host firewall


    [Service]

    Type=oneshot

    RemainAfterExit=true

    ExecStart=/bin/sh /home/cloudservice/setup_firewall

    '
  owner: root
  path: /etc/systemd/system/config-firewall.service
  permissions: '0644'
- content: '

    [Unit]

    Description=Container which we can connect via ssh

    /usr/sbin/sshd -D -e -p 3022

    ExecStop=/usr/bin/docker stop container-sshd

    ExecStopPost=/usr/bin/docker rm container-sshd

    Restart=always

    '
  owner: root
  path: /etc/systemd/system/container-sshd.service
  permissions: '0644'
- content: '

    [Unit]

    Description=Suspend when container is detected to be idle

    Wants=gcr-online.target

    After=gcr-online.target


    [Service]

    ExecStart=/usr/bin/python /home/cloudservice/suspend_on_idle.py 1 30 hermit-demo
    us-central1-a broad-achilles 3022

    Restart=always'
  owner: root
  path: /etc/systemd/system/suspend-on-idle.service
  permissions: '0644'
- content: "\n{\n\t\"live-restore\": false,\n\t\"log-opts\": {\n                \"\
    tag\": \"{{.Name}}\"\n        },\n\t\"storage-driver\": \"overlay2\",\n\t\"mtu\"\
    : 1460\n}\n"

  permissions: '0644'

    \ activity_timeout, name, zone, project, port):\n    suspend_fail_count = 0\n\
    \    last_bytes_transmitted = None\n    last_activity = time.time()\n    while\
    \ True:\n        bytes_transmitted = get_bytes_transmitted(port)\n        if last_bytes_transmitted\
    \ != bytes_transmitted:\n            last_bytes_transmitted = bytes_transmitted\n\
    \            last_activity = time.time()\n            log.info(\"%s\", f\"active\
    \ (last_bytes_transmitted={last_bytes_transmitted})\")\n\n            # reset\
    \ if there's some activity. Only want to count the number of failed suspends since\
    \ we've decided that we're idle\n            suspend_fail_count = 0\n        elapsed_since_activity\
    \ = time.time() - last_activity\n        if elapsed_since_activity > activity_timeout:\n\
    \            log.info(\n                \"%s\",\n                f\"{elapsed_since_activity}\
    \ seconds elapsed since last sign of activity. Suspending...\",\n            )\n\
    \            successful_suspend = suspend_instance(name, zone, project)\n    \
    \        log.info(\n                f\"Suspend is over. Waiting for {activity_timeout/60}\
    \ minutes before polling again\"\n            )\n            time.sleep(activity_timeout)\n\
    \            # this is likely after the VM has been resumed but ...\n        \
    \    # it's been observed that the suspend command often reports failure even\
    \ though the vm successfully suspended.\n            # I don't have a reliable\
    \ way of telling whether it worked or not. (Specificly, it gets a timeout trying\
    \ to read the response\n            # to the suspend request, because while it\
    \ was\n            # reading, the VM got suspended. ) In the event that suspend\
    \ _really_ is broken, we want to shutdown as that's\n            # safer then\
    \ leaving the machine run forever. So, let's go with a heuristic of, if it fails\
    \ repeatedly then shutdown.\n\n            if not successful_suspend:\n      \
    \          log.info(\n                    \"Suspend command reportedly failed\
    \ -- but not sure if that's true. Incrementing fail count\"\n                )\n\
    \                suspend_fail_count += 1\n\n                if suspend_fail_count\
    \ > 10:\n                    log.info(\n                        f\"suspending\
    \ failed {suspend_fail_count} times. Shutting down as a last resort\"\n      \
    \              )\n                    _shutdown()\n\n            log.info(\"Resuming\
    \ polling...\")\n        time.sleep(poll_frequency)\n\n\ndef _shutdown():\n  \
    \  return_code = subprocess.run([\"shutdown\", \"--poweroff\"]).returncode\n \
    \   log.info(f\"return code = {return_code}\")\n\n\ndef suspend_instance(name,\
    \ zone, project):\n    has_ssd = os.path.exists(\"/mnt/disks/local-ssd-0\")\n\
    \    cmd = [\n        \"docker\",\n        \"run\",\n        \"google/cloud-sdk\"\
    ,\n        \"gcloud\",\n        \"compute\",\n        \"instances\",\n       \
    \ \"suspend\",\n        name,\n        \"--zone\",\n        zone,\n        \"\
    --project\",\n        project,\n    ]\n\n    if has_ssd:\n        cmd.append(\"\
    --discard-local-ssd=false\")\n\n    return_code = subprocess.run(cmd).returncode\n\
    \n    return return_code == 0\n\n\ndef get_bytes_transmitted(port):\n    output\
    \ = subprocess.check_output([\"iptables\", \"-nvxL\", \"CONTAINER_SSH\"])\n  \
    \  lines = output.decode(\"utf8\").split(\"\\n\")\n\n    def parse():\n      \
    \  for line in lines:\n            if (\n                f\"tcp dpt:{port}\" in\
    \ line\n            ):  # find the line for the rule for traffic on the port\n\
    \                m = re.match(\"\\\\s*(\\\\d+)\\\\s+(\\\\d+)\\\\s+.\", line)\n\
    \                if m is not None:\n                    return int(m.group(2))\n\
    \        return None  # could not find the rule\n\n    result = parse()\n    if\
    \ result is None:\n        print(f\"Could not parse: {output}\")\n    return result\n\
    \n\nif __name__ == \"__main__\":\n    main()\n"
  path: /home/cloudservice/suspend_on_idle.py
- content: '

    set -ex

    echo "initial mount state"

    mount

    echo "Setting up ubuntu home directory permissions..."

    usermod -u 2000 ubuntu

    groupmod -g 2000 ubuntu

    chown 2000:2000 /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu

    chmod -R 700 /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh

    chown -R 2000:2000 /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh

    echo "Mounting home directory into place..."

    mount --bind /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/ /home/ubuntu

    chown ubuntu:ubuntu /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh/authorized_keys

    chmod 0666 /var/run/docker.sock

    echo "Starting up services..."

    systemctl daemon-reload

    systemctl restart docker

    systemctl start container-sshd.service

    systemctl start suspend-on-idle.service

    echo "final mount state"

    mount

    echo "hermit-setup.sh complete"

    '
  path: /home/cloudservice/hermit-setup.sh
- content: '

    # Create a chain for tracking traffic to ssh in container

    iptables -N CONTAINER_SSH

    iptables -I INPUT -j CONTAINER_SSH

    iptables -A CONTAINER_SSH -p tcp --dport 3022

    iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --dport 3022 -j ACCEPT

    '
  path: /home/cloudservice/setup_firewall
- content: '

    [Unit]

    Description=Configures the host firewall


    [Service]

    Type=oneshot

    RemainAfterExit=true

    ExecStart=/bin/sh /home/cloudservice/setup_firewall

    '
  owner: root
  path: /etc/systemd/system/config-firewall.service
  permissions: '0644'
- content: '

    [Unit]

    Description=Container which we can connect via ssh

    Wants=gcr-online.target config-firewall.service

    After=gcr-online.target config-firewall.service


    [Service]

    Environment="HOME=/home/cloudservice"

    StandardOutput=append:/var/log/hermit.log

    ExecStartPre=/usr/bin/docker-credential-gcr configure-docker --registries us-central1-docker.pkg.dev

    ExecStart=/usr/bin/docker run --rm --name=container-sshd --network=host -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    -v /tmp:/tmp -v /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu:/home/ubuntu us-central1-docker.pkg.dev/depmap-omics/docker/hermit-dev-env:v1
    /usr/sbin/sshd -D -e -p 3022

    ExecStop=/usr/bin/docker stop container-sshd

    ExecStopPost=/usr/bin/docker rm container-sshd

    Restart=always

    '
  owner: root
  path: /etc/systemd/system/container-sshd.service
  permissions: '0644'
- content: '

    [Unit]

    Description=Suspend when container is detected to be idle

    Wants=gcr-online.target

    After=gcr-online.target


    [Service]

    ExecStart=/usr/bin/python /home/cloudservice/suspend_on_idle.py 1 30 hermit-demo
    us-central1-a broad-achilles 3022

    Restart=always'
  owner: root
  path: /etc/systemd/system/suspend-on-idle.service
  permissions: '0644'
- content: "\n{\n\t\"live-restore\": false,\n\t\"log-opts\": {\n                \"\
    tag\": \"{{.Name}}\"\n        },\n\t\"storage-driver\": \"overlay2\",\n\t\"mtu\"\
    : 1460\n}\n"
  owner: root
  path: /etc/docker/daemon.json
  permissions: '0644'

#cloud-config
bootcmd:
- echo in-bootcmd
- echo "Starting cloudinit bootcmd..." >> /var/log/hermit.log
- mount
- umount /tmp
- mount --bind /var/tmp /tmp
- echo in-bootcmd-after-tmp-remount
- mount
- echo "Starting check filesystem /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd" >> /var/log/hermit.log

runcmd:

    systemctl start container-sshd.service

    systemctl start suspend-on-idle.service

#cloud-config
bootcmd:
- echo in-bootcmd
- echo "Starting cloudinit bootcmd..." >> /var/log/hermit.log
- mount
- umount /tmp
- mount --bind /var/tmp /tmp
- echo in-bootcmd-after-tmp-remount
- mount
- echo "Starting check filesystem /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd" >> /var/log/hermit.log
- fsck -C 1 -a /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd >> /var/log/hermit.log
- echo "Finished checking filesystem /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd" >> /var/log/hermit.log
- mkdir -p /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd
- echo "Mounting /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd" as /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd
  >> /var/log/hermit.log
- mount -t ext4 /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd
- mkdir -p /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh
- echo "Finished hermit VM setup" >> /var/log/hermit.log
runcmd:
- echo in-runcmd
- bash /home/cloudservice/hermit-setup.sh >> /var/log/hermit.log 2>&1
users:
- name: ubuntu
write_files:
- content: 'ssh-rsa 
    pmontgom@MBRCF0-08B

    '
  path: /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh/authorized_keys
  permissions: '0700'
- content: "import subprocess\nimport re\nimport time\nimport argparse\nimport os\n\
    \n# cmd to suspend: docker run google/cloud-sdk gcloud compute instances suspend\
    \ {name} --zone {zone}\n# but needs additional scopes/permissions. Create a service\
    \ account for this? Actually just a broadening the scope looks sufficient\nimport\
    \ logging\n\nlog = logging.getLogger(__name__)\n\n\ndef main():\n    parser =\
    \ argparse.ArgumentParser()\n    parser.add_argument(\"poll_frequency\", type=float)\n\
    \    parser.add_argument(\"activity_timeout\", type=float)\n    parser.add_argument(\"\
    name\")\n    parser.add_argument(\"zone\")\n    parser.add_argument(\"project\"\
    )\n    parser.add_argument(\"port\")\n    args = parser.parse_args()\n\n    logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)\n\
    \n    # fetch docker image at the beginning just to make sure it's successful\
    \ and we don't wait until\n    # we actually need it.\n    subprocess.check_call([\"\
    docker\", \"pull\", \"google/cloud-sdk\"])\n\n    poll(\n        args.poll_frequency\
    \ * 60,\n        args.activity_timeout * 60,\n        args.name,\n        args.zone,\n\
    \        args.project,\n        args.port,\n    )\n\n\ndef poll(poll_frequency,\
    \ activity_timeout, name, zone, project, port):\n    suspend_fail_count = 0\n\
    \    last_bytes_transmitted = None\n    last_activity = time.time()\n    while\
    \ True:\n        bytes_transmitted = get_bytes_transmitted(port)\n        if last_bytes_transmitted\
    \ != bytes_transmitted:\n            last_bytes_transmitted = bytes_transmitted\n\
    \            last_activity = time.time()\n            log.info(\"%s\", f\"active\
    \ (last_bytes_transmitted={last_bytes_transmitted})\")\n\n            # reset\
    \ if there's some activity. Only want to count the number of failed suspends since\
    \ we've decided that we're idle\n            suspend_fail_count = 0\n        elapsed_since_activity\
    \ = time.time() - last_activity\n        if elapsed_since_activity > activity_timeout:\n\
    \            log.info(\n                \"%s\",\n                f\"{elapsed_since_activity}\
    \ seconds elapsed since last sign of activity. Suspending...\",\n            )\n\
    \            successful_suspend = suspend_instance(name, zone, project)\n    \
    \        log.info(\n                f\"Suspend is over. Waiting for {activity_timeout/60}\
    \ minutes before polling again\"\n            )\n            time.sleep(activity_timeout)\n\
    \            # this is likely after the VM has been resumed but ...\n        \
    \    # it's been observed that the suspend command often reports failure even\
    \ though the vm successfully suspended.\n            # I don't have a reliable\
    \ way of telling whether it worked or not. (Specificly, it gets a timeout trying\
    \ to read the response\n            # to the suspend request, because while it\
    \ was\n            # reading, the VM got suspended. ) In the event that suspend\
    \ _really_ is broken, we want to shutdown as that's\n            # safer then\
    \ leaving the machine run forever. So, let's go with a heuristic of, if it fails\
    \ repeatedly then shutdown.\n\n            if not successful_suspend:\n      \
    \          log.info(\n                    \"Suspend command reportedly failed\
    \ -- but not sure if that's true. Incrementing fail count\"\n                )\n\
    \                suspend_fail_count += 1\n\n                if suspend_fail_count\
    \ > 10:\n                    log.info(\n                        f\"suspending\
    \ failed {suspend_fail_count} times. Shutting down as a last resort\"\n      \
    \              )\n                    _shutdown()\n\n            log.info(\"Resuming\
    \ polling...\")\n        time.sleep(poll_frequency)\n\n\ndef _shutdown():\n  \
    \  return_code = subprocess.run([\"shutdown\", \"--poweroff\"]).returncode\n \
    \   log.info(f\"return code = {return_code}\")\n\n\ndef suspend_instance(name,\
    \ zone, project):\n    has_ssd = os.path.exists(\"/mnt/disks/local-ssd-0\")\n\
    \    cmd = [\n        \"docker\",\n        \"run\",\n        \"google/cloud-sdk\"\
    ,\n        \"gcloud\",\n        \"compute\",\n        \"instances\",\n       \
    \ \"suspend\",\n        name,\n        \"--zone\",\n        zone,\n        \"\
    --project\",\n        project,\n    ]\n\n    if has_ssd:\n        cmd.append(\"\
    --discard-local-ssd=false\")\n\n    return_code = subprocess.run(cmd).returncode\n\
    \n    return return_code == 0\n\n\ndef get_bytes_transmitted(port):\n    output\
    \ = subprocess.check_output([\"iptables\", \"-nvxL\", \"CONTAINER_SSH\"])\n  \
    \  lines = output.decode(\"utf8\").split(\"\\n\")\n\n    def parse():\n      \
    \  for line in lines:\n            if (\n                f\"tcp dpt:{port}\" in\
    \ line\n            ):  # find the line for the rule for traffic on the port\n\
    \                m = re.match(\"\\\\s*(\\\\d+)\\\\s+(\\\\d+)\\\\s+.\", line)\n\
    \                if m is not None:\n                    return int(m.group(2))\n\
    \        return None  # could not find the rule\n\n    result = parse()\n    if\
    \ result is None:\n        print(f\"Could not parse: {output}\")\n    return result\n\
    \n\nif __name__ == \"__main__\":\n    main()\n"

- echo "Finished hermit VM setup" >> /var/log/hermit.log
runcmd:
- echo in-runcmd
- bash /home/cloudservice/hermit-setup.sh >> /var/log/hermit.log 2>&1
users:
- name: ubuntu
write_files:
- content: 'ssh-rsa 
    pmontgom@MBRCF0-08B

    '
  path: /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh/authorized_keys
  permissions: '0700'
- content: "import subprocess\nimport re\nimport time\nimport argparse\nimport os\n\
    \n# cmd to suspend: docker run google/cloud-sdk gcloud compute instances suspend\
    \ {name} --zone {zone}\n# but needs additional scopes/permissions. Create a service\
    \ account for this? Actually just a broadening the scope looks sufficient\nimport\
    \ logging\n\nlog = logging.getLogger(__name__)\n\n\ndef main():\n    parser =\
    \ argparse.ArgumentParser()\n    parser.add_argument(\"poll_frequency\", type=float)\n\
    \    parser.add_argument(\"activity_timeout\", type=float)\n    parser.add_argument(\"\
    name\")\n    parser.add_argument(\"zone\")\n    parser.add_argument(\"project\"\
    )\n    parser.add_argument(\"port\")\n    args = parser.parse_args()\n\n    logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)\n\
    \n    # fetch docker image at the beginning just to make sure it's successful\
    \ and we don't wait until\n    # we actually need it.\n    subprocess.check_call([\"\
    docker\", \"pull\", \"google/cloud-sdk\"])\n\n    poll(\n        args.poll_frequency\
    \ * 60,\n        args.activity_timeout * 60,\n        args.name,\n        args.zone,\n\
    \        args.project,\n        args.port,\n    )\n\n\ndef poll(poll_frequency,\
    \ activity_timeout, name, zone, project, port):\n    suspend_fail_count = 0\n\
    \    last_bytes_transmitted = None\n    last_activity = time.time()\n    while\
    \ True:\n        bytes_transmitted = get_bytes_transmitted(port)\n        if last_bytes_transmitted\
    \ != bytes_transmitted:\n            last_bytes_transmitted = bytes_transmitted\n\
    \            last_activity = time.time()\n            log.info(\"%s\", f\"active\
    \ (last_bytes_transmitted={last_bytes_transmitted})\")\n\n            # reset\
    \ if there's some activity. Only want to count the number of failed suspends since\
    \ we've decided that we're idle\n            suspend_fail_count = 0\n        elapsed_since_activity\
    \ = time.time() - last_activity\n        if elapsed_since_activity > activity_timeout:\n\
    \            log.info(\n                \"%s\",\n                f\"{elapsed_since_activity}\
    \ seconds elapsed since last sign of activity. Suspending...\",\n            )\n\
    \            successful_suspend = suspend_instance(name, zone, project)\n    \
    \        log.info(\n                f\"Suspend is over. Waiting for {activity_timeout/60}\
    \ minutes before polling again\"\n            )\n            time.sleep(activity_timeout)\n\
    \            # this is likely after the VM has been resumed but ...\n        \
    \    # it's been observed that the suspend command often reports failure even\
    \ though the vm successfully suspended.\n            # I don't have a reliable\
    \ way of telling whether it worked or not. (Specificly, it gets a timeout trying\
    \ to read the response\n            # to the suspend request, because while it\
    \ was\n            # reading, the VM got suspended. ) In the event that suspend\
    \ _really_ is broken, we want to shutdown as that's\n            # safer then\
    \ leaving the machine run forever. So, let's go with a heuristic of, if it fails\
    \ repeatedly then shutdown.\n\n            if not successful_suspend:\n      \
    \          log.info(\n                    \"Suspend command reportedly failed\
    \ -- but not sure if that's true. Incrementing fail count\"\n                )\n\
    \                suspend_fail_count += 1\n\n                if suspend_fail_count\
    \ > 10:\n                    log.info(\n                        f\"suspending\
    \ failed {suspend_fail_count} times. Shutting down as a last resort\"\n      \
    \              )\n                    _shutdown()\n\n            log.info(\"Resuming\
    \ polling...\")\n        time.sleep(poll_frequency)\n\n\ndef _shutdown():\n  \
    \  return_code = subprocess.run([\"shutdown\", \"--poweroff\"]).returncode\n \
    \   log.info(f\"return code = {return_code}\")\n\n\ndef suspend_instance(name,\
    \ zone, project):\n    has_ssd = os.path.exists(\"/mnt/disks/local-ssd-0\")\n\
    \    cmd = [\n        \"docker\",\n        \"run\",\n        \"google/cloud-sdk\"\
    ,\n        \"gcloud\",\n        \"compute\",\n        \"instances\",\n       \
    \ \"suspend\",\n        name,\n        \"--zone\",\n        zone,\n        \"\
    --project\",\n        project,\n    ]\n\n    if has_ssd:\n        cmd.append(\"\
    --discard-local-ssd=false\")\n\n    return_code = subprocess.run(cmd).returncode\n\
    \n    return return_code == 0\n\n\ndef get_bytes_transmitted(port):\n    output\
    \ = subprocess.check_output([\"iptables\", \"-nvxL\", \"CONTAINER_SSH\"])\n  \
    \  lines = output.decode(\"utf8\").split(\"\\n\")\n\n    def parse():\n      \
    \  for line in lines:\n            if (\n                f\"tcp dpt:{port}\" in\
    \ line\n            ):  # find the line for the rule for traffic on the port\n\
    \                m = re.match(\"\\\\s*(\\\\d+)\\\\s+(\\\\d+)\\\\s+.\", line)\n\
    \                if m is not None:\n                    return int(m.group(2))\n\
    \        return None  # could not find the rule\n\n    result = parse()\n    if\
    \ result is None:\n        print(f\"Could not parse: {output}\")\n    return result\n\
    \n\nif __name__ == \"__main__\":\n    main()\n"
  path: /home/cloudservice/suspend_on_idle.py
- content: '

    set -ex

    echo "initial mount state"

    mount

    echo "Setting up ubuntu home directory permissions..."

    usermod -u 2000 ubuntu

    groupmod -g 2000 ubuntu

    chown 2000:2000 /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu

    chmod -R 700 /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh

    chown -R 2000:2000 /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh

    echo "Mounting home directory into place..."

    mount --bind /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/ /home/ubuntu

    chown ubuntu:ubuntu /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh/authorized_keys

    chmod 0666 /var/run/docker.sock

    echo "Starting up services..."

    systemctl daemon-reload

    systemctl restart docker

    systemctl start container-sshd.service

    systemctl start suspend-on-idle.service

    echo "final mount state"

    mount

    echo "hermit-setup.sh complete"

    '
  path: /home/cloudservice/hermit-setup.sh
- content: '

    # Create a chain for tracking traffic to ssh in container

    iptables -N CONTAINER_SSH

    iptables -I INPUT -j CONTAINER_SSH

    iptables -A CONTAINER_SSH -p tcp --dport 3022

    iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --dport 3022 -j ACCEPT

    '
  path: /home/cloudservice/setup_firewall
- content: '

    [Unit]

    Description=Configures the host firewall


    [Service]

    Type=oneshot

    RemainAfterExit=true

    ExecStart=/bin/sh /home/cloudservice/setup_firewall

    '
  owner: root
  path: /etc/systemd/system/config-firewall.service
  permissions: '0644'
- content: '

    [Unit]

    Description=Container which we can connect via ssh

    Wants=gcr-online.target config-firewall.service

    After=gcr-online.target config-firewall.service


    [Service]

    Environment="HOME=/home/cloudservice"

    StandardOutput=append:/var/log/hermit.log

    ExecStartPre=/usr/bin/docker-credential-gcr configure-docker --registries us-central1-docker.pkg.dev

    ExecStart=/usr/bin/docker run --rm --name=container-sshd --network=host -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    -v /tmp:/tmp -v /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu:/home/ubuntu us-central1-docker.pkg.dev/depmap-omics/docker/hermit-dev-env:v1
    /usr/sbin/sshd -D -e -p 3022

    ExecStop=/usr/bin/docker stop container-sshd

    ExecStopPost=/usr/bin/docker rm container-sshd

    Restart=always

    '
  owner: root
  path: /etc/systemd/system/container-sshd.service
  permissions: '0644'
- content: '

    [Unit]

    Description=Suspend when container is detected to be idle

    Wants=gcr-online.target

    After=gcr-online.target


    [Service]

    ExecStart=/usr/bin/python /home/cloudservice/suspend_on_idle.py 1 30 hermit-demo
    us-central1-a broad-achilles 3022

    Restart=always'
  owner: root
  path: /etc/systemd/system/suspend-on-idle.service
  permissions: '0644'
- content: "\n{\n\t\"live-restore\": false,\n\t\"log-opts\": {\n                \"\
    tag\": \"{{.Name}}\"\n        },\n\t\"storage-driver\": \"overlay2\",\n\t\"mtu\"\
    : 1460\n}\n"
  owner: root
  path: /etc/docker/daemon.json
  permissions: '0644'

    \ zone, project):\n    has_ssd = os.path.exists(\"/mnt/disks/local-ssd-0\")\n\
    \    cmd = [\n        \"docker\",\n        \"run\",\n        \"google/cloud-sdk\"\
    ,\n        \"gcloud\",\n        \"compute\",\n        \"instances\",\n       \
    \ \"suspend\",\n        name,\n        \"--zone\",\n        zone,\n        \"\
    --project\",\n        project,\n    ]\n\n    if has_ssd:\n        cmd.append(\"\
    --discard-local-ssd=false\")\n\n    return_code = subprocess.run(cmd).returncode\n\
    \n    return return_code == 0\n\n\ndef get_bytes_transmitted(port):\n    output\
    \ = subprocess.check_output([\"iptables\", \"-nvxL\", \"CONTAINER_SSH\"])\n  \
    \  lines = output.decode(\"utf8\").split(\"\\n\")\n\n    def parse():\n      \
    \  for line in lines:\n            if (\n                f\"tcp dpt:{port}\" in\
    \ line\n            ):  # find the line for the rule for traffic on the port\n\
    \                m = re.match(\"\\\\s*(\\\\d+)\\\\s+(\\\\d+)\\\\s+.\", line)\n\
    \                if m is not None:\n                    return int(m.group(2))\n\
    \        return None  # could not find the rule\n\n    result = parse()\n    if\
    \ result is None:\n        print(f\"Could not parse: {output}\")\n    return result\n\
    \n\nif __name__ == \"__main__\":\n    main()\n"
  path: /home/cloudservice/suspend_on_idle.py
- content: '

    set -ex

    echo "initial mount state"

    mount

    echo "Setting up ubuntu home directory permissions..."

    usermod -u 2000 ubuntu

    groupmod -g 2000 ubuntu

    chown 2000:2000 /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu

    chmod -R 700 /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh

    chown -R 2000:2000 /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh

    echo "Mounting home directory into place..."

    mount --bind /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/ /home/ubuntu

    chown ubuntu:ubuntu /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh/authorized_keys

    chmod 0666 /var/run/docker.sock

    echo "Starting up services..."

    systemctl daemon-reload

    systemctl restart docker

    systemctl start container-sshd.service

    systemctl start suspend-on-idle.service

    echo "final mount state"

    mount

    echo "hermit-setup.sh complete"

    '
  path: /home/cloudservice/hermit-setup.sh
- content: '

    # Create a chain for tracking traffic to ssh in container

    iptables -N CONTAINER_SSH

    iptables -I INPUT -j CONTAINER_SSH

    iptables -A CONTAINER_SSH -p tcp --dport 3022

    iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --dport 3022 -j ACCEPT

    '
  path: /home/cloudservice/setup_firewall
- content: '

    [Unit]

    Description=Configures the host firewall


    [Service]

    Type=oneshot

    RemainAfterExit=true

    ExecStart=/bin/sh /home/cloudservice/setup_firewall

    '
  owner: root

- content: '

    [Unit]

    Description=Container which we can connect via ssh

    -v /tmp:/tmp -v /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu:/home/ubuntu us-central1-docker.pkg.dev/depmap-omics/docker/hermit-dev-env:v1
    /usr/sbin/sshd -D -e -p 3022

    ExecStop=/usr/bin/docker stop container-sshd

    ExecStopPost=/usr/bin/docker rm container-sshd

    Restart=always

    '

  permissions: '0644'

items.value:
#cloud-config
bootcmd:
- echo in-bootcmd
- echo "Starting cloudinit bootcmd..." >> /var/log/hermit.log
- mount
- umount /tmp
- mount --bind /var/tmp /tmp
- echo in-bootcmd-after-tmp-remount
- mount
- echo "Starting check filesystem /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd" >> /var/log/hermit.log
- fsck -C 1 -a /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd >> /var/log/hermit.log
- echo "Finished checking filesystem /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd" >> /var/log/hermit.log
- mkdir -p /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd
- echo "Mounting /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd" as /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd
  >> /var/log/hermit.log
- mount -t ext4 /dev/disk/by-id/google-hermit-demo-pd /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd
- mkdir -p /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh
- echo "Finished hermit VM setup" >> /var/log/hermit.log
runcmd:
- echo in-runcmd
- bash /home/cloudservice/hermit-setup.sh >> /var/log/hermit.log 2>&1
users:
- name: ubuntu
write_files:
- content: 'ssh-rsa 
    pmontgom@MBRCF0-08B

    '
  path: /mnt/disks/hermit-demo-pd/home/ubuntu/.ssh/authorized_keys
  permissions: '0700'
- content: "import subprocess\nimport re\nimport time\nimport argparse\nimport os\n\
    \n# cmd to suspend: docker run google/cloud-sdk gcloud compute instances suspend\
    \ {name} --zone {zone}\n# but needs additional scopes/permissions. Create a service\
    \ account for this? Actually just a broadening the scope looks sufficient\nimport\
    \ logging\n\nlog = logging.getLogger(__name__)\n\n\ndef main():\n    parser =\
    \ argparse.ArgumentParser()\n    parser.add_argument(\"poll_frequency\", type=float)\n\
    \    parser.add_argument(\"activity_timeout\", type=float)\n    parser.add_argument(\"\
    name\")\n    parser.add_argument(\"zone\")\n    parser.add_argument(\"project\"\
    )\n    parser.add_argument(\"port\")\n    args = parser.parse_args()\n\n    logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)\n\
    \n    # fetch docker image at the beginning just to make sure it's successful\
    \ and we don't wait until\n    # we actually need it.\n    subprocess.check_call([\"\
    docker\", \"pull\", \"google/cloud-sdk\"])\n\n    poll(\n        args.poll_frequency\
    \ * 60,\n        args.activity_timeout * 60,\n        args.name,\n        args.zone,\n\
    \        args.project,\n        args.port,\n    )\n\n\ndef poll(poll_frequency,\
    \ activity_timeout, name, zone, project, port):\n    suspend_fail_count = 0\n\
    \    last_bytes_transmitted = None\n    last_activity = time.time()\n    while\
    \ True:\n        bytes_transmitted = get_bytes_transmitted(port)\n        if last_bytes_transmitted\
    \ != bytes_transmitted:\n            last_bytes_transmitted = bytes_transmitted\n\
    \            last_activity = time.time()\n            log.info(\"%s\", f\"active\
    \ (last_bytes_transmitted={last_bytes_transmitted})\")\n\n            # reset\
    \ if there's some activity. Only want to count the number of failed suspends since\
    \ we've decided that we're idle\n            suspend_fail_count = 0\n        elapsed_since_activity\
    \ = time.time() - last_activity\n        if elapsed_since_activity > activity_timeout:\n\
    \            log.info(\n                \"%s\",\n                f\"{elapsed_since_activity}\
    \ seconds elapsed since last sign of activity. Suspending...\",\n            )\n\
    \            successful_suspend = suspend_instance(name, zone, project)\n    \
    \        log.info(\n                f\"Suspend is over. Waiting for {activity_timeout/60}\
    \ minutes before polling again\"\n            )\n            time.sleep(activity_timeout)\n\
    \            # this is likely after the VM has been resumed but ...\n        \
    \    # it's been observed that the suspend command often reports failure even\
    \ though the vm successfully suspended.\n            # I don't have a reliable\
    \ way of telling whether it worked or not. (Specificly, it gets a timeout trying\
    \ to read the response\n            # to the suspend request, because while it\
    \ was\n            # reading, the VM got suspended. ) In the event that suspend\
    \ _really_ is broken, we want to shutdown as that's\n            # safer then\
    \ leaving the machine run forever. So, let's go with a heuristic of, if it fails\
    \ repeatedly then shutdown.\n\n            if not successful_suspend:\n      \
    \          log.info(\n                    \"Suspend command reportedly failed\
    \ -- but not sure if that's true. Incrementing fail count\"\n                )\n\
    \                suspend_fail_count += 1\n\n                if suspend_fail_count\
    \ > 10:\n                    log.info(\n                        f\"suspending\
    \ failed {suspend_fail_count} times. Shutting down as a last resort\"\n      \
    \              )\n                    _shutdown()\n\n            log.info(\"Resuming\
    \ polling...\")\n        time.sleep(poll_frequency)\n\n\ndef _shutdown():\n  \
    \  return_code = subprocess.run([\"shutdown\", \"--poweroff\"]).returncode\n \
    \   log.info(f\"return code = {return_code}\")\n\n\ndef suspend_instance(name,\
    \ zone, project):\n    has_ssd = os.path.exists(\"/mnt/disks/local-ssd-0\")\n\
    \    cmd = [\n        \"docker\",\n        \"run\",\n        \"google/cloud-sdk\"\
    ,\n        \"gcloud\",\n        \"compute\",\n        \"instances\",\n       \
    \ \"suspend\",\n        name,\n        \"--zone\",\n        zone,\n        \"\
    --project\",\n        project,\n    ]\n\n    if has_ssd:\n        cmd.append(\"\
    --discard-local-ssd=false\")\n\n    return_code = subprocess.run(cmd).returncode\n\
    \n    return return_code == 0\n\n\ndef get_bytes_transmitted(port):\n    output\
    \ = subprocess.check_output([\"iptables\", \"-nvxL\", \"CONTAINER_SSH\"])\n  \
    \  lines = output.decode(\"utf8\").split(\"\\n\")\n\n    def parse():\n      \
    \  for line in lines:\n            if (\n                f\"tcp dpt:{port}\" in\
    \ line\n            ):  # find the line for the rule for traffic on the port\n\
    \                m = re.match(\"\\\\s*(\\\\d+)\\\\s+(\\\\d+)\\\\s+.\", line)\n\
    \                if m is not None:\n                    return int(m.group(2))\n\
    \        return None  # could not find the rule\n\n    result = parse()\n    if\
    \ result is None:\n        print(f\"Could not parse: {output}\")\n    return result\n\
    \n\nif __name__ == \"__main__\":\n    main()\n"
